Stones: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=15 May 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Centre back]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2001–2011 |youthclubs1 = [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] | years1 = 2011–2013 |clubs1 = [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] |caps1 = 24 |goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2013–2016 |clubs2 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps2 = 77 |goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2016– |clubs3 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] |caps3 = 62 |goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps1 = 3 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps2 = 2 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2013–2015 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps3 = 12 |nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2014– |nationalteam4 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps4 = 37 |nationalgoals4 = 2 | club-update = 10:36, 7 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16:37, 18 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''John Stones''' (born 28 May 1994) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]]. Mainly a [[centre back]], he can also play as a [[right back]].
Stones began his career with [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]], making his first-team debut in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] in March 2012 as a 17-year-old. He joined Premier League club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] for around £3 million in January 2013 and amassed 95 appearances over four seasons. In August 2016, he signed for Manchester City for an initial £47.5 million with add-ons. He won the Premier League and [[EFL Cup]] in 2018.
Stones made his senior debut for England in May 2014 after previously being [[Cap (sport)|capped]] by [[England national youth football team|England youth teams]] at [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. He was chosen in [[List of England national football team World Cup and European Championship squads|England's squads]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Barnsley=== Born in [[Barnsley]], South Yorkshire, Stones came through the [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] youth academy to sign a professional contract in December 2011.<ref>{{Hugman|25445|accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref> He made his first-team debut in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] on 17 March 2012, in a 4–0 defeat to [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] at [[Oakwell]], replacing [[Scott Wiseman]] after 52 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17323945 |title=Barnsley 0–4 Reading |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 March 2012 |accessdate=19 March 2012}}</ref> He scored his only goal for Barnsley on his first start, equalising before half time in a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] first round match away to [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] on 11 August 2012, which resulted in a 4–3 victory after extra time.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19123950 |title=Rochdale 3–4 Barnsley (aet) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2012 |accessdate=12 August 2012}}</ref> A week later, he made his first league start, in a 1–0 victory against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/barnsley-vs-mboro/report/262139 |title=Tykes claim overdue home win |accessdate=26 April 2015 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=18 August 2012}}</ref>
===Everton=== [[File:T Howard J Stones F Campbell 2014.jpg|thumb|left|Stones and Everton goalkeeper [[Tim Howard]] defending against [[Fraizer Campbell]] of [[Cardiff City]] in March 2014]]
Stones signed a five-and-a-half-year deal with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 31 January 2013,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/01/31/blues-sign-stones |title=Blues sign Stones |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=31 January 2013 |accessdate=31 January 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130204132229/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/01/31/blues-sign-stones |archivedate=4 February 2013}}</ref> for a transfer fee reported to be in the region of £3 million.<ref>{{cite news |title=Everton sign defender John Stones from Barnsley |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21286890 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 February 2013 |accessdate=18 October 2014}}</ref> He was an unused substitute for three [[Premier League]] matches that season, beginning on 10 February in a 2–0 defeat to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21311607 |title=Man Utd 2–0 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=10 February 2013 |accessdate=26 April 2015}}</ref>
He made his debut for Everton against [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] in the League Cup second round on 28 August 2013, a 2–1 win after extra time at [[Goodison Park]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23776650 |title=Everton 2–1 Stevenage (aet) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2013 |accessdate=16 September 2013}}</ref> He made his league debut as a late substitute for [[Steven Naismith]] in a 1–0 home win over [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 14 September 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23999387 |title=Everton 1–0 Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=14 September 2013 |accessdate=16 September 2013}}</ref> He started his first Premier League game for Everton in a 1–1 draw against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] at the [[Britannia Stadium]] on 1 January 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25513272 |title=Stoke City 1–1 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Emlyn |last=Begley |date=1 January 2014 |accessdate=1 January 2014}}</ref>
[[File:Chelsea 1 Everton 0 (15890813963).jpg|thumb|Stones defending against Chelsea's [[Loïc Rémy]] in February 2015]]
On 7 August 2014, Stones signed a new five-year contract to keep him with Everton until 2019.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/england-international-john-stones-puts-4020369 |title=England international John Stones puts pen to paper on new five-year deal at Everton |newspaper=Daily Mirror |first=Alex |last=Richards |date=7 August 2014 |accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref> He suffered an ankle injury against Manchester United on 5 October, ruling him out for between 10 and 14 weeks.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29552025 |title=Everton: John Stones could miss rest of 2014 with ankle injury |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 October 2014 |accessdate=9 October 2014}}</ref> Despite the injury, Stones was listed among the nominees for the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy 2014 Award]] alongside fellow Everton winger [[Gerard Deulofeu]] and fellow [[England national football team|England]] internationals [[Calum Chambers]], [[Luke Shaw]] and eventual winner [[Raheem Sterling]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/dec/20/liverpool-raheem-sterling-wins-golden-boy-award |title=Liverpool's Raheem Sterling wins Europe's Golden Boy award for 2014 |date=20 December 2014 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
Stones was sent off in Everton's 4–1 away win at [[BSC Young Boys|Young Boys]] in the last 32 of the [[UEFA Europa League]] on 19 February 2015, for conceding a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]] with a foul on [[Guillaume Hoarau]], who went on to miss the spot-kick.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31523676 |title=BSC Young Boys 1–4 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Mike |last=Whalley |date=19 February 2015 |accessdate=19 February 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Everton in a 3–0 home win against Manchester United on 26 April 2015, heading in the team's second goal of the game.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32371018 |title=Everton 3–0 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Richard |last=Winton |date=26 April 2015 |accessdate=26 April 2015}}</ref>
In July and August 2015, Stones was reportedly the subject of three bids from Chelsea – of £20 million, £26 million and £30 million – all of which were rejected by Everton.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33584857 |title=Chelsea's John Stones bid angers Everton boss Roberto Martinez |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 July 2015 |accessdate=29 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2540960/chelsea-john-stones-bid-of-26m-rejected-by-everton--sources |title=Chelsea John Stones bid of £26 million rejected by Everton, say sources |publisher=ESPN FC |date=29 July 2015 |accessdate=29 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33977836 |title=John Stones: Everton defender not for sale despite '£30m Chelsea bid' |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=18 August 2015 |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> Stones was reported to have handed in a [[Transfer market#Transfer request|request to leave]] Everton, but this was also refused.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34055843 |title=John Stones: Chelsea target makes Everton transfer request |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Simon |last=Stone |date=25 August 2015 |accessdate=25 August 2015}}</ref> On 28 December, Stones fouled Stoke City's [[Marko Arnautović]] in added time at the end of a home match, conceding a penalty from which the same player scored the winning goal in a 4–3 victory.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35148469 |title=Everton 3–4 Stoke |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Luke |last=Reddy |date=28 December 2015 |accessdate=29 December 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== On 9 August 2016, [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] completed the signing of Stones for £47.5 million on a six-year deal with a potential extra £2.5 million in add-ons, making him the world's second most expensive defender in history, behind [[David Luiz]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/10528801/john-stones-joins-manchester-city-in-475m-deal |title=John Stones joins Manchester City in £47.5m deal |publisher=Sky Sports |date=9 August 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/09/manchester-city-complete-signing-of-john-stones-from-everton |title=Manchester City complete £47.5m signing of John Stones from Everton |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=9 August 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37020275 |title=John Stones: Manchester City sign Everton defender for £47.5m |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.soccertransfers.net/manchester-city-sign-john-stones-for-47-5m-on-a-six-year-deal-50456/ |title=Manchester City sign John Stones for £47.5m on a six-year deal |publisher=SoccerTransfers.net |date=9 August 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160927200403/http://www.newsigning.co.uk/manchester-city-sign-john-stones-for-47-5m-on-a-six-year-deal-50456/ |archivedate=27 September 2016}}</ref> The announcement followed shortly after the leaking of his arrival, having been included in City's [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|Champions League play-off round]] squad registration list which [[UEFA]] had published on their website prior to confirmation of the move.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/08/09/john-stones-named-in-manchester-citys-champions-league-squad-on/ |title=John Stones completes move to Manchester City from Everton, after Uefa website unexpectedly breaks news |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Matt |last=Law |date=9 August 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}}</ref> Through a 15% sell-on clause, Barnsley received £6.78 million from Stones' transfer to Manchester City, an amount larger than any transfer fee they had received in their history.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bilton |first1=Toby |title=Barnsley net £7m from John Stones' move to Manchester City |url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/barnsley-fc/barnsley-net-7m-from-john-stones-move-to-manchester-city-1-8058522 |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=Yorkshire Post |date=9 August 2016}}</ref>
[[File:John Stones and Vincent Kompany (36243869980).jpg|thumb|Stones and [[Vincent Kompany]] warming up on Manchester City's US tour, July 2017]]
Stones made his debut for City four days later as they began the new season with a 2–1 home win over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], partnering [[Aleksandar Kolarov]] in [[Pep Guardiola]]'s first competitive game in charge.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wallace |first1=Sam |title=Manchester City 2 Sunderland 1: Late Paddy McNair own goal hands Pep Guardiola winning start |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/0/manchester-city-vs-sunderland-live-score-and-goal-updates-from-p/ |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=13 August 2017}}</ref> On 6 January 2017, he scored his first goal for the Citizens, heading the last goal of a 5–0 win over [[West Ham United]] at [[London Stadium]] in the third round of the FA Cup.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cottingham |first1=Robert |title=Man City defender John Stones reacts to first goal for the club |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/man-city-west-ham-stones-12419263 |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=6 January 2017}}</ref> He scored again on 21 February to give them the lead in a 5–3 comeback win over [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in the last 16 of the [[UEFA Champions League]],<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cross |first1=John |title=Goal hero John Stones laments Manchester City's poor defending after pulsating Etihad epic |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/goal-hero-john-stones-laments-9865212 |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=Daily Mirror |date=21 February 2017}}</ref> but after losing the tie on away goals he spoke of his disappointment with the team's defending.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Robson |first1=James |title=John Stones is brutally honest about Man City's Champions League exit |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-john-stones-monaco-12748837 |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=Manchester Evening News |date=16 March 2017}}</ref>
Stones was subject to criticism from the media for his performances over the season.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Coerts |first1=Stefan |title='I Am Going in the Right Direction' – Man City Defender Stones Brushes off Criticism |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/i-am-going-in-the-right-direction-man-city-defender-stones/ivk6kzku4rzr1spebey8w8fr2 |accessdate=13 September 2017 |publisher=Goal.com |date=24 February 2017}}</ref> In interviews at the end of the season, he said that he was disappointed to have not won any trophies and was keen to improve.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Ducker |first1=James |title=John Stones: My football brain was not good enough, but I am learning under Man City manager Pep Guardiola |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/05/19/john-stones-football-brain-not-good-enough-learning-man-city/ |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=19 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Hunter |first1=Andy |title=Manchester City's John Stones disappointed with trophy-less season |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jun/10/manchester-city-john-stones-disappointed-trophies-england |accessdate=13 September 2017 |work=The Observer |date=10 June 2017}}</ref>
On 13 September 2017, Stones scored twice in a 4–0 Champions League group win away to [[Feyenoord]], including a second-minute header that was City's fastest goal in the competition's history.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Sajad |first1=Kal |title=Feyenoord 0–4 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41216368 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |date=13 September 2017}}</ref> He added another header on 1 November in a 4–2 win at [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] that put his team into the last 16 with two games remaining.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Begley |first1=Emlyn |title=Napoli 2–4 Manchester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41822027 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 November 2017}}</ref> Seventeen days later, he withdrew after half an hour of the match away to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] with a hamstring injury that ruled him out for the next six weeks.<ref>{{cite news |title=John Stones: Man City defender set for six-week injury lay-off |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42040601 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 November 2017}}</ref> Stones suffered another injury in March 2018 while on international duty, and in April, Guardiola strongly denied press rumours that he was looking to sell the defender.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pep Guardiola: 'As long as I'm in Manchester, John Stones will be as well' |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/04/28/pep-guardiola-long-manchester-john-stones-will/ |accessdate=24 June 2018 |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=28 April 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:John Stones 2018-06-24 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Stones [[Goal celebration|celebrates scoring]] for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
Stones was named in manager [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]]'s [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup squads#England|21-man squad]] for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in May 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/u20s-world-cup-squad-announcement-280513 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130615071407/http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/u20s-world-cup-squad-announcement-280513 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=15 June 2013 |title=Final squad named |publisher=The Football Association |date=28 May 2013 |accessdate=17 June 2013}}</ref> He made his [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] debut on 16 June, in a 3–0 win in a warm-up game against [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/uruguay-report-160613 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130624222816/http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/uruguay-report-160613 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 June 2013 |title=Training win for Three Lions |publisher=The Football Association |date=16 June 2013 |accessdate=17 June 2013}}</ref> He made his [[England national under-21 football team|under-21s]] debut against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]] on 13 August 2013, playing the entire 90 minutes of a 6–0 win for England at [[Bramall Lane]].<ref>{{cite news |title=International friendly: England Under-21s beat Scotland U21s 6–0 |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/england-u21-vs-scotland-u21/292365 |accessdate=24 June 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=13 August 2013}}</ref>
He was named as a standby player for England's [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] squad, but was not included in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup squads#England|final squad]]. Stones made his England debut on 30 May in a 3–0 friendly win over [[Peru national football team|Peru]] at Wembley, replacing Everton teammate [[Leighton Baines]] for the final 15 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27383301 |title=England 3–0 Peru |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=30 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}}</ref> On 3 September 2014, Stones made his first England start in a friendly against [[Norway national football team|Norway]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28784340 |title=Besiktas 0–0 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Chris |last=Bevan |date=19 August 2014 |accessdate=19 August 2014}}</ref> Five days later, in England's first match of [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualification]], Stones made his competitive debut in a 2–0 victory away to [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] at [[St. Jakob-Park]], [[Basel]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29008534 |title=Switzerland 0–2 England |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=8 September 2014 |accessdate=8 September 2014}}</ref>
Stones was selected in [[Roy Hodgson]]'s [[UEFA Euro 2016 squads#England|23-man squad]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]] but did not play any of England's four games in the tournament.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2016/may/england-final-uefa-euro-2016-squad-announcement |title=Roy Hodgson confirms final squad for UEFA EURO 2016 |publisher=The Football Association |date=31 May 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/everton/368/blog/post/2905118/evertons-barkley-and-stones-emerge-from-england-euro-failure-unscathed |title=Everton's Barkley and Stones emerge from England Euro failure unscathed |publisher=ESPN FC |date=30 June 2016 |accessdate=10 August 2016}}</ref>
He was named in the 23-man England [[2018 FIFA World Cup squads#England|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> On 24 June, Stones scored his first two international goals in a 6–1 victory over [[Panama national football team|Panama]] during their second group stage match of the tournament.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/world-cup/news/england-vs-panama-final-score-recap-harry-kane-hat-trick-john-stones-double-powers-three-lions-into-round-of-16 |title=England vs. Panama final score, recap: Harry Kane hat trick, John Stones double powers Three Lions into round of 16 |publisher=CBS Sports |accessdate=24 June 2018 |date=24 June 2018}}</ref> He became the first Manchester City player to score for England at a [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup finals]] since [[Trevor Francis]] in [[1982 FIFA World Cup|1982]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/john-stones-manchester-city-record-14822456 |title=John Stones equals a Man City record with World Cup goal heroics |last=Brennan |first=Stuart |date=24 June 2018 |work=men|access-date=28 June 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== Known for his technical ability and physical presence, Stones is celebrated for being a ball-playing central defender.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mcfcwatch.com/2017/10/26/city-stat-john-stones-is-european-footballs-pass-master-in-201718 |title=City Stat: John Stones is European football’s pass master in 2017/18 – City Watch |publisher=}}</ref> Teammates and coaches have praised his composure with the ball,<ref name="goal.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/stones-has-as-much-composure-as-any-defender-in-europe-says/3ggjk0euxk8o1cjjszcmd11vm |title=England: Southgate gushes over Stones, compares him to Pique and Boateng - Goal.com |publisher=}}</ref> defensive skills,<ref name="mcfcwatch.com">{{cite web |url=https://www.mcfcwatch.com/2017/10/26/city-stat-john-stones-is-european-footballs-pass-master-in-201718/ |title=City Stat: John Stones is European football’s pass master in 2017/18 – City Watch |publisher=}}</ref> range of passing,<ref name=auto>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2016/aug/09/john-stones-pep-guardiola-flaws-manchester-city-everton |title=John Stones: a rare talent but value only if Pep Guardiola removes the flaws – Andy Hunter |first=Andy |last=Hunter |date=9 August 2016 |website=the Guardian}}</ref>, vision<ref name="mcfcwatch.com"/> and versatility.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2016/august/john-stones-in-quotes |title=John Stones: In Quotes |website=MCFC}}</ref>.
[[Joleon Lescott]] said of his ability: "John can do things most defenders can’t – a little feign here and there, maybe a turn to get out of trouble when he needs to – and that’s what is going to set him apart from others – the ability to do things others can’t. He’ll do his job and defend well, but there will be moments when he does something special and you’ll just go ‘ah, that’s why he’s regarded as the best.’ He doesn’t seem to get fazed by anything and always seems calm and he never hides".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/first-team-news/2017/november/joleon-lescott-impressed-with-john-stones |title=Lescott: Stones has the X-Factor |website=MCFC}}</ref> Manchester City and England teammate [[Kyle Walker]] added "You don't quite appreciate him until you are playing alongside him. He rarely gets beat, he is great on the ball and he is very calm and level-headed."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11679/11130440/man-citys-kyle-walker-hails-unbelievable-john-stones-and-special-pep-guardiola |title=Man City's Kyle Walker hails 'unbelievable' John Stones and 'special' Pep Guardiola |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>
